column4: i have a hosed grub after installing winblows. Now I can boot windows, used knoppix and can see my linux partitions. Ive tried mounting sda1 and doing grub-install, and going into the grub shell doing root (hd0,1) etc. but nothing is working.
if you go into grub's command line and do a find /boot/grub, does it show anything?
no it cant find it - thats the bizarre thing
how about root (hd0), setup?
yeah i tried that series of steps - i have it saved and have used them before. I did the following:
sudo grub, find /boot/grub/stage1, root (hd0,1), setup (hd0)
thats worked for me in the past but not this time. It gives me an error saying it cant determine the filesystem type. weird
sounds like winblows rewrote the MBR... grub-install from knoppix didn't fix it?
i know its hosed good. Couldnt find it. Could i try reinstalling linux ontop without formatting and have it reinstall grub?
I haven't tried that before, but if you have everything backed up, i don't see why not
actually im remembering earlier when i tried i couldnt even chroot
what does your partitions look like?
one sec booting install dvd now - will need to look again to get that info - one sec
kk
i have 3 partitions: /dev/sda1, ext3, 262337MB, /dev/sda2. ntfs, 45568MB for win, and /dev/sda5,swap,12165MB
holy crap that's a huge swap
must have been created by the last install ;)
damn never saw that - 12gb? thats enormous. I need to do something about that
hmm, well, my suggestion would be to delete/resize that swap, but for the grub issue, i'd try a grub-install on sda and include your winblows install in it
AHA! ive been trying to put it on /dev/sda1 so you are saying try to grub-install on /dev/sda2 (ntfs partition?)
no, just sda... grub writes to the MBR, which is a partition, but not readily visible
